forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 51. South southwest wind 7 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 5pm, then rain showers. Cloudy. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. South southwest wind 12 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 32 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between three quarters and one inch possible.

weather_report:
In the heart of Downtown San Francisco, the air is tinged with anticipation as winter rains begin to draw near. As twilight descends, the sky hangs heavy with clouds, their grayish hues reminiscent of whispered secrets waiting to be shared. Fog clings like a soft blanket, draping the city in a quiet embrace, blurring the edges of familiar landmarks. The Golden Gate Bridge, often a sentinel against the turbulent seas, now teeters on the periphery of visibility, as if contemplating its own reflections in the fading light.

The forecast hints at an unrelenting downpour as night deepens, ushering in showers that will persist into the morrow. With temperatures sliding toward the cool confines of the low fifties, it would be prudent to layer up, embracing the comfort of a cozy jacket, perhaps accompanied by a hat to shield against the impending dampness. For those who venture out, the city invites simple pleasures—consider a visit to a tucked-away café for a warm drink, where the juxtaposition of steaming mugs and rain-soaked streets creates an ambience that is at once intimate and invigorating. Alternatively, a stroll beneath an umbrella along the waterfront could yield a fresh perspective on the waves lapping against the shore, their rhythm mirroring the pulse of the city that never quite sleeps.
